critique: The document is a presidential order regarding the appointment of Mrs. Lucile Ensminger to a classified position in the Navy Department. The order mentions the death of her husband, Charles Lee Ensminger, in the line of duty. The primary emotion conveyed is sadness due to the mention of the death of Mrs. Ensminger's husband. There might be a hint of joy that the president is signing the order to help the widow. There is no indication of anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. The intensity of sadness is moderate, as it is a formal document. The intensity of joy is low, as it is not the primary focus.
